newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil tumbles, diesel premiums slide.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil tumbles, diesel premiums slide.

text.p: NWE gas oil tumbled in sympathy with underlying futures on Wednesday while lower demand and better supply depressed diesel barge premiums, traders said.

Benchmark IPE futures for front month November slid by $6 to finish at $217.25 a tonne after U.S. weekly stock data showed tanks were filling up with heating oil and there was no immediate prospect of sharply colder U.S. weather.

A low sulphur diesel barge winter grade traded at Nov IPE +$20 and $21.25 for ARA for early November, up to $8 lower than the start of the week, due to fragile German end-user demand and better supply from increased refinery runs.
Diesel cargoes were quiet with premiums notionally steady.
In heating oil, a refinery grade cargo traded at Nov IPE +$5 cif Bremen for early November and a refinery grade barge was sold for Nov IPE +$0.75 fob ARA, both around unchanged.

"It's still too warm (in Germany)," one broker said, noting moderate autumn temperatures in Europe and the expected arrival of more trans-Atlantic arbitrage cargoes were slowing physical demand and keeping a lid on premiums. Physical trade around the continent in both heating oil and diesel remained meagre.
